result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kajuan R Stewart Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kajuan R Stewart Jr in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Kajuan R Stewart Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pre-trial. Parties report that case remains in trial posture. Case adjourned to Branch 15 for jury trial on November 14th, 2022 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Kajuan R Stewart Jr in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Kajuan R Stewart Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 083440,
Payable Number: 1028866,
Receipt Number: 22RP034780,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Kajuan R Stewart in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant request more time to retain private counsel.  Court set a status of counsel date.  This matter will be held in person in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (6/30/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.M.L.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kajuan R Stewart in court. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision ofJoshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-28-2022 @1:30p
